name: widget_layout
objective: Check that widgets are displayed correctly in the content area
description:
Under the Widget tab widget must appear in two groups : 
- a first group on the top of the content area which contains the user home screen widgets
- a second group which contains all the widgets 
Those two groups must be separated with a thin line as in the reference document.
pre_condition:
- open the homescreen settings panel (user menu -> settings -> gnome-control-center opens -> click on home screen settings icon)
- select the "Widgets" tab
- have some widgets installed on desktop

steps.expected: the currently installed widgets must appear in the top area
a second group with all available widgets must appear in the bottom area
a toolbar with category selection and search field must be present between the two areas

author: sdx

name: widget_mgt1
objective: Check that functionalities of home screen widgets are available
description:
A right click on a home screen widget (top group) must pop up a small window at the right side of the application icon with the two following functionalities : 
- Remove from Home
- Open in Browser
pre_condition:
- open the homescreen settings panel (user menu -> settings -> gnome-control-center opens -> click on home screen settings icon)
- select the "Widgets" tab
- have some widgets installed on desktop

steps.description: right click on an installed widget in the top area
steps.expected: a popup menu with "Remove from Home" and "Open in Browser" items must appear

author: sdx

name: widget_mgt2
objective: Check that functionalities of other widgets (bottom group) are available
description:
A right click on a widget of the below group must pop up a small window at the right side of the widget icon with the two following functionalities : 
- Add to Home

pre_condition:

steps.expected: a popup menu with "Add to Home" and "Open in Browser" items must appear

name: remove_home_widget

description:
When a right click is performed on an home screen widget, and then a single click is done on the 'Remove from Home' functionality, the widget should disappear in the top group and in the home screen. 

TODO: when ? instantly ?
pre_condition:
- open the homescreen settings panel (user menu -> settings -> gnome-control-center opens -> click on home screen settings icon)
- select the "Widgets" tab
- have some widgets installed on desktop

steps.description: right click on an installed widget in the top area

steps.expected: the selected widget must be removed from the installed widgets list displayed in the top area

steps.description: close the settings window (or minimise it to see the desktop)

name: find_widget
objective: Check that the search form of the widget of the bottom group works
description: When a string is typed in the search form, a subset of all the available widgets must be visible. The displayed list result must be coherent with the typed string.
pre_condition:
- open the homescreen settings panel (user menu -> settings -> gnome-control-center opens -> click on home screen settings icon)
- select the "Widgets" tab
- have some widgets installed on desktop

steps.description: type a pattern in the search field of the bottom area
steps.expected: the list of available widgets must be updated and match the pattern
the search field must be cleared and the list of widgets must match the selected category
